long_desc: Intermediate Spanish I is the first part of a twosemester course sequence 82241, 82242 designed to familiarize students with the cultures and perspectives of the Spanishspeaking world. Students will develop selfexpression across a range of culturally significant topics, improving their speaking, listening, reading, and writing skills while working with longer passages of language in context through reading, writing and listeningviewing e.g. tv series, movies, short novels, plays and frequently working in groups and pairs, and utilizing technologies that enhance learning opportunities and promote skill development. The course provides extracurricular opportunities to interact with members of the Spanishspeaking community.

custom_fields.goals: Students will develop greater mastery of contemporary spoken and written Spanish with activities related to the immediate world and everyday activities.Students will improve their listening and reading comprehension through exposure to a variety of texts of different genres and audiovisual media.Students will develop an improved comprehension of the richness and complexity of various Spanishspeaking cultures in order to broaden their perspective on the world and inspire in them a sense of curiosity towards other ways of living and thinking.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Elem Spanish II, placement, or permission of the professor
custom_fields.assessment_structure:
15%	Attendance, participation, and current news

custom_fields.relevance: This is course is the first segment of the intermediate Spanish sequence at Carnegie Mellon University. The focus of the course is on interactions and the expression of opinions on issues related to daily life. As such, a strong communicative approach is followed to learn, practice, and promote the usage and understanding of Spanish from Latin America, Spain, and the U.S. The course offers diverse oral, written, listening, and reading activities to the student in order to study different topics while practicing and expanding upon grammatical and lexical items pertaining to each chapter. Cultural awareness is enhanced through exposure to an array of target-language media as well as through in-class oral presentations and discussions.
